page.title: 06Industry in Haddenham
page.content: Until WW2 most people in Haddenham were employed in{agriculture}and its connected industries. The agricultural slump in the 1870s forced people to move out of the area.{Modern industry {has grown since 1945.}There are now {three large companies,}two medium sized companies and several smaller firms. All the{industry is 'light',} and mainly engineering. Many companies chose to move to Haddenham because {property was cheap,}and the work force skilled. Companies such as Airtech moved to the village to be{near the {air-field}which was used extensivly in the War. {Access by road}to London, Oxford, St Albans, Amersham and Aylesbury is good, but there is no railway station.
